ARABIC: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَٰحِشَةَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And when Lut said to his people: 'Do you approach depravity with open eyes?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (Remember) Lot, when he said to his people: "Why do you indulge in obscenities when you know (it is evil)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We also sent Lot, and recall when he told his people: "Do you commit shameless acts with your eyes open?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Lot asked his people, "Do you understandably commit indecency?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And (remember) Lut when he said to his people, “What! You stoop to the shameful whereas you can see?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And (remember) Lut! When he said to his people: "Do you commit immoral sins while you see"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And (We sent) Lut, when he said to his people: What! do you commit indecency while you see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And Lot, when he said to his people, 'What, do you commit indecency with your eyes open?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And Lot! when he said unto his folk: Will ye commit abomination knowingly?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: And tell of Lot. He said to his people, "Will you commit evil knowingly?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And Lut! what time he said unto his people: commit ye indecency while ye see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [We also sent] Lot, when he said to his people, ‘What! Do you commit this indecency while you look on?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (We also sent) Lut (as a messenger): behold, He said to his people, "Do ye do what is shameful though ye see (its iniquity)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (remember) Lout (Lot)! When he said to his people. Do you commit Al-Fahishah (evil, great sin, every kind of unlawful sexual intercourse, sodomy, etc.) while you see (one another doing evil without any screen, etc.)?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And Lot, he said to his nation: 'Do you commit indecencies with your eyes open!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And Lot, when he said to his people, “Do you commit lewdness with open eyes?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Do you commit immorality while you are seeing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [27:54] And Lot (Lūtan is in the accusative because of an implied udhkur, ‘mention’, before it, and it [Lūtan] is substituted by [the following, idh qāla …]), when he said to his people, ‘What! Do you commit [such] abomination, namely, homosexual intercourse, while you watch?, that is to say, while you watch one another, [so] engrossed [are you] in the sinful act?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And Lot!) We sent him to his people (when he said unto his folk: will you commit abomination) sodomy (knowingly) while knowing it to be an abomination?
